title: 2 Simple Ways to Change Your Username or Handle on YouTube

steps.title: Open the YouTube app.
steps.content: Open the YouTube app. It's a red app with a white triangle in the middle. If you aren't signed into YouTube , tap the profile picture in the top-right corner, then enter your email address and password to continue. You can also create a new account .

steps.title: Tap the You tab.
steps.content: Tap the You tab. It's the circular image you chose in the bottom-right corner of the screen. This displays your page. [1] X Research source If you have not uploaded a profile image for your account, your profile image appears as a colored circle with your initial in the middle.

steps.title: Tap Your channel.
steps.content: Tap Your channel . This option is near the top of the page, below your channel name. If you want to change the name of an attached channel, instead tap Switch account , tap the channel's name, and then tap the profile icon again.

steps.title: Tap the pencil icon.
steps.content: Tap the pencil icon. You can find this to the right of Manage videos . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Change your name.
steps.content: Change your name. This is your channel name and display name; it appears at the top of your profile, underneath videos, and in comments. Tap the pencil icon next to Name . Enter a name that properly represents you and your content. Tap Save when you're finished. You can change your name twice every 14 days. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Enter a new handle.
steps.content: Enter a new handle. Your handle is unique to you and is followed by "@". Tap the pencil icon next to Handle and enter a new one. Tap Save when you're finished. If the handle is taken, you'll see a red "!". YouTube will offer you an available handle. If you don't want to use the generated handle, enter a different one. You can change your handle twice every 14 days. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Go to https://www.youtube.com in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.youtube.com in a web browser. You can use any web browser on Windows or Mac. [5] X Research source If you aren't already logged into YouTube, click Sign in and enter your email address and password to continue.

steps.title: Click your profile image.
steps.content: Click your profile image. It's in the top-right side of the YouTube page. A drop-down menu will appear. If you have not uploaded a profile image for your account, your profile image appears as a colored circle with your initial in the middle.

steps.title: Click YouTube Studio.
steps.content: Click YouTube Studio . You can find this underneath Your channel .

steps.title: Click Customization.
steps.content: Click Customization . This will be in the left panel, underneath Earn . [6] X Research source

steps.title: Click Basic info.
steps.content: Click Basic info . You can find this at the top of the page, next to Branding . [7] X Research source

steps.title: Enter a new name.
steps.content: Enter a new name. This is your channel name and display name; it appears at the top of your profile, underneath videos, and in comments. [8] X Research source Choose a username that properly represents you and your content. You can change your name twice every 14 days. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Enter a new handle.
steps.content: Enter a new handle. Your handle is unique to you and is followed by "@". You can change your handle twice every 14 days. [10] X Research source If the handle is taken, you'll see a red "!". YouTube will offer you an available handle. If you don't want to use the generated handle, enter a different one.

steps.title: Click PUBLISH.
steps.content: Click PUBLISH . This is the blue button in the top-right corner, underneath your profile picture. [11] X Research source Your changes will be saved. When you want to share your URL , your new handle will be displayed.
